intro: Fleischmannia bergantinensis, commonly known as the Bergantín cactus, is a species of flowering cactus native to the arid regions of northern Mexico. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stems covered in white, woolly spines. The plant produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by cactus enthusiasts.
